p.s: Michel Barnier, EU commissioner for the withdrawlwithdrawal negotiations of the UK in the course of Brexit, delivered his speech at the European American Chamber of Commerce in New York, the 10th of July in 2018.
In his speech he addresses the topic of the consequences of Brexit, the characteristics of the relationship between the UK and the EU and the EU as the most open market in the world.
He held his speech after having thanked for the opportunity to speak about this topic with the purpose of convincing of his criticism of Brexit.
In the Texttext Barnier announces his regret for the UK leaving the EU.
In regards to the relationship of the both he claims that Brexit will evoke a disagreement on non-existing trade (cf. l. 5).
He also thinks that Brexit will effectaffect both the UK and the EU.
However, he is out of the opinion that the consequences for the UK would be higher (cf. l. 8f.).
Barnier counts results of Brexit, for instance the impact on value chains, which are currently closely integrated (ll. 6f.) in the EU states.
Especially the manufactoring, logistics, agricultural and food sectors will be effected.
He goes on by offering a further argument for his claim.
In the lines 11-14 he is talking about the difficulties the UK will face when trying to sign another trade deals for ex.
He even assumes the US would refuse the deal.
Thus he suggests having also in financial services in close relationship to the UK, which is a mutual interest.
To his mind, the future Free Trade Agreement with the UK should consider the right of establishment with applying EU rules.
Towards the end of his text he mentions that the EU market is the most open market in the world, which is also welcoming the UK and still will not change even the UK is leaving.
In conclusion, one could say that Barnier has the opinion that Brexit will have a negative effect on the EU but mostly or the UK.
Nevertheless the EU will not change.
